title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 3,119.85 USD/T on February 11, 2026, marking a 0.59% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 2.21%, though they remain 18.64% higher than a year ago. Recent news highlights a 4-week low on February 9 at 3031.00 USD/T and a fall from a 3-year high earlier in February.

title: LME aluminium prices recover with cash offers at $3098/t while inventories follow a declining trend
summary: LME aluminium cash bid prices increased by 1.09% to USD 3,096 per tonne on February 11, with cash offers rising 1.14% to USD 3,098 per tonne. Three-month bids and offers also saw similar gains of around 1.1-1.13%. Inventories continued a declining trend, indicating potential global supply shortages.

title: Aluminum Price Today: China Trading Curbs Stall Rally Amid Supply Constraints
summary: Aluminum prices stand at $3,159.93 USD, down 0.12% over the past seven days but up 7.16% in the last 30 days amid a strong uptrend. China's curbs on high-frequency trading have stalled the rally, though supply disruptions in regions like Iceland and Mozambique provide support. Technicals show consolidation near $3,200 with key support at $3,130.

title: Indian Alumina Price Rises to $311.5/mt in Overseas Trade, Up from $308/mt in January
summary: Overseas alumina transactions saw Indian prices rise to $311.5/mt on February 12, 2026, up from $308/mt in January. This reflects tightening supply dynamics in the alumina market linked to aluminum production. Related news mentions Arconic seeking spot aluminum amid US supply tightness.

title: US ALUMINUM: Extruders remain cautious for 2026 after an up-and-down 2025
summary: US aluminum extruders express caution for 2026 following a volatile 2025, with promising first-half demand fading into lower activity by year-end. New orders for extruded products rose 5.1% through November 2025 compared to 2024, but shipments declined 1.4% through September. Market participants anticipate potential tariff reforms and lower premiums, amid competition from imports.

title: LME aluminium prices recover with cash offers at $3098/t while inventories follow a declining trend
summary: LME aluminum cash offers recovered to $3,098 per tonne on February 11, 2026, with 3-month bids rising 1.13% to $3,126 per tonne. Inventories slightly declined by 0.25% to 485,750 tonnes, while live warrants increased marginally. The LME alumina Platts price dipped 0.21% to $308.08 per tonne.

title: Top aluminum buyer seeks $218 million purchase as Trump tariffs roil market
summary: Arconic Corp., a major US aluminum buyer, seeks 90 million pounds of spot market aluminum for Q2 2026, equivalent to 10% of monthly US consumption, amid Trump tariff disruptions. This shift from annual contracts adds pressure to a constrained market, with US prices near $5,342 per ton including premiums. The company has secured half its 2026 needs via contracts and plans further spot buys.

title: Century Aluminum Backs New U.S. Smelter Built Around Next-Generation Smelting Technology
summary: Century Aluminum is partnering with Emirates Global Aluminum (EGA) to develop a new primary aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, using EGA's proprietary EX smelting technology. This advanced platform aims to improve productivity, reduce energy consumption, and lower emissions, producing up to 750,000 metric tons annually. The project supports U.S. supply chain resilience and sustainability in aluminum manufacturing for sectors like automotive and aerospace.

title: US to build largest aluminum plant with 500,000-ton annual capacity
summary: The U.S. is constructing its first primary aluminum smelter since the 1980s in Inola, Oklahoma, led by Century Aluminum in partnership with EGA, with a capacity of 500,000 tons annually including high-purity aluminum for defense. The facility uses next-generation smelting technology to onshore production, reduce import reliance, and enhance domestic manufacturing. It aligns with efforts to strengthen supply chains and create jobs amid high demand for aluminum in aerospace and other sectors.

title: Aluminum at the Centre of Global Industrial Transformation AICE 2026
summary: AICE 2026 will feature over 80 expert presentations on aluminum production, recycling, and innovations addressing energy-intensive challenges and carbon scrutiny. The event emphasizes closed-loop recycling systems for construction and automotive applications, alongside digitalization and automation for efficiency and sustainability. It highlights standards harmonization and the role of aluminum in infrastructure and energy transition.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 972.07 USD/T on February 11, 2026, down 0.30% from the previous day, though up 3.08% over the past month and 27.07% year-over-year. It is expected to trade at 990.10 USD/T by quarter-end and 1070.89 USD/T in 12 months. Historical high was 1945 USD/T in September 2021.

title: Domestic Large Steel Mills' Guiding Prices for Various Series on February 12 - SMM Steel Mill Guiding Prices
summary: Large domestic steel mills in China released guiding prices for various steel series on February 12. This update from SMM provides insights into current pricing trends amid ongoing market dynamics. Specific price adjustments reflect daily market conditions.

title: New owner for closed steel plant
summary: The former Samuel Coil Processing plant in Cleveland, closed by Worthington Industries a year ago, has been sold to two companies sharing ownership equally. The sale exceeded the $15 million asking price, with one buyer using part of the property and securing an undisclosed tenant for the rest. The 2005-built facility was on land from the Cleveland-Cuyahoga County Port Authority.

title: ArcelorMittal upgraded as tighter EU imports to lift steel prices
summary: Jefferies upgraded ArcelorMittal to Buy from Hold, raising the price target to €62 from €44, citing tighter EU import restrictions that will boost steel prices. This reflects expectations of improved market conditions due to trade protection measures. The upgrade highlights positive outlook for the steel giant amid policy changes.

title: Mid-February 2026 Steel Pipe Market: Navigating the Final Stretch of the Holiday Hiatus
summary: Steel pipe production, including seamless and welded pipes, remains idle due to holiday hiatus, with supply chains dormant and pre-holiday stocks depleted. Production is expected to resume in a staggered manner from the week of February 23, prioritizing order backlogs for products like API 5L and ASTM grades. New orders may face lead times of 50-65 days initially.

title: ArcelorMittal sees 2% rise in steel sales
summary: ArcelorMittal forecasts a 2% increase in global steel demand ex-China for 2026, with production and shipments rising across regions due to operational improvements and trade protections. In Europe, domestic mills are expected to regain market share from imports via CBAM and TRQ mechanisms. The company's 2025 sales were $61.35 billion, with net income at $3.15 billion.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose slightly to 3,044 CNY/T on February 12, 2026, amid Chinese mills curtailing operations ahead of Lunar New Year holidays, with rebar futures hitting an eight-week low below 3,050 CNY/T. Blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces are pausing for maintenance, potentially exacerbated by pollution alerts in Hebei. Prices fell to 3,040 CNY/T on February 11.

title: Copper Edges Higher on Weaker Dollar, but China Demand Softens Ahead of Lunar New Year
summary: Copper prices rose modestly on February 11, 2026, supported by a weaker U.S. dollar, though China demand slowed ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday. The SHFE most-active contract closed up 0.31% at 102,180 yuan per ton, while LME three-month copper gained 0.31% to $13,155 per ton. SHFE inventories surged to their highest since March, and COMEX stocks hit a record 536,563 tons.

title: Why is copper price surging again and will it stay above $13000 or fall back? Copper rise: Analysts insights and market outlook explained. Here's what should investors do now?
summary: Copper prices rebounded above $13,000 per metric ton after dipping to $12,528, driven by buying interest near key support and a weaker dollar. Three-month LME copper rose 0.8% to $13,001 per ton despite weekly losses of 1.2%. Analysts note high inventories may cap gains, with focus shifting to supply limits and electrification demand post-seasonal factors.

title: Copper Prices Drop Before China Break: Market Analysis
summary: Copper prices consolidated around $5.90 per pound in New York markets during February 2026 amid market holidays and economic forces in China. The analysis highlights volatility ahead of the China break, reflecting broader demand concerns and holiday impacts.

title: Peel Mining Announces Landmark Sale of South Cobar Copper Project to Aeris Resources
summary: Peel Mining Limited has agreed to sell its South Cobar Copper Project, including the Mallee Bull and Wirlong deposits, to Aeris Resources for $214 million via a Scheme of Arrangement. The deal involves demerging Peel's remaining Cobar Basin assets into a new ASX-listed entity, NewCo, for shareholders. The transaction accelerates development using Aeris' expertise and is recommended by Peel's board, pending approvals.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices rose to 5.97 USD/Lbs on February 12, 2026, amid projections of 5% refined copper output growth in China for 2026. The China Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts this growth as half of 2025's rate, while Goldman Sachs notes a 600,000-ton surplus last year despite record highs. Prices are supported by energy transition demand and a softer dollar.

title: Copper leads 2026 base metals outlook, but analysts warn January rally unsustainable
summary: Analysts forecast copper deficits in 2026 due to tight supply amid energy transition and AI data-center demand, positioning it as a top base metal. Forecasts indicate meaningful price gains over 2025 averages, though January's record highs are seen as unsustainable with caution for 2027. Supply constraints persist, with manufacturers potentially responding to high prices by adjusting behavior.

title: Western Copper and Gold Announces C$50 Million Bought Deal Financing
summary: Western Copper and Gold has secured a C$50 million bought deal financing to advance permitting and engineering for its Casino copper-gold project in Yukon. The funds support development of this premier greenfield project using responsible mining practices in collaboration with First Nations. The offering is subject to regulatory approvals and TSX/NYSE listing.

title: Three Forces Shaping Copper's Path Forward
summary: Copper market begins 2026 with strong gains driven by AI data centers, EVs, and renewable energy creating structural demand deficits. Supply constraints from long mine development times and water scarcity exacerbate volatility. The article highlights copper's critical role in electrification and green technology innovations.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto partners with AWS in a two-year agreement to supply the first Nuton low-carbon copper for U.S. data center components. This innovation promotes sustainable copper production technology. AWS supports the initiative while integrating the eco-friendly material.

title: Nickel Headed to $20,000 as Indonesia Limits Production, EV Demand Surges
summary: Nickel prices bounced between $16,500-$18,500/ton in January after briefly exceeding $19,000, supported by Indonesia's commitment to flat-to-down ore production targets of 250-260 million tons for 2026. EV demand remains robust with 20% underlying growth continuing, with analysts expecting nickel to move toward $20,000 per ton within the near term as production discipline is verified.

title: Indonesia Cuts Weda Bay Nickel Mining Quota, Prices Rise
summary: Indonesia sharply cut PT Weda Bay Nickel's 2026 mining quota to 12 million wet metric tons from 32 million wet tons in 2025, causing nickel prices to climb. The LME benchmark three-month nickel contract rose 0.70% to $17,990 a ton, with the Shanghai Futures Exchange contract climbing 2.49% to 140,570 yuan per metric ton.

title: Weda Bay Nickel Receives Sharply Reduced 2026 Quota
summary: Indonesia revised its total nickel ore production target to 260-270 million tons for 2026, down from 379 million tons in 2025, with the objective to support LME nickel prices within a stable $19,000-20,000/ton range. Project Blue forecasts a nickel market surplus of 249kt Ni in 2026, though higher prices may face resistance from downstream consumers due to structural shifts in EV battery markets and weak stainless steel demand.

title: Crude Oil Rises, Nickel Prices Extend Gains for Fourth Day, Silver Surges
summary: Nickel prices rose for a fourth consecutive day, hitting a two-week high after Indonesia signaled significant production cuts. LME nickel futures climbed 2.23% to $17,880.0 per ton as market sentiment strengthened on expectations of constrained Indonesian supply.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel Prices Continue to Rise on February 12
summary: SMM #1 refined nickel prices were quoted at 140,200-150,500 yuan/mt with an average price of 145,350 yuan/mt, up 2,750 yuan/mt on the day. Prices continued their upward momentum following Indonesia's production quota announcements.

title: Weda Bay Nickel receives sharply reduced 2026 quota
summary: PT Weda Bay Nickel, the world's largest nickel mine, received an initial 2026 quota of 12 million wet metric tonnes, representing a 71% reduction from its 2025 approval. This aligns with Indonesia's broader plan to reduce national nickel ore production to 260-270 million tonnes in 2026, down from 379 million tonnes in 2025, with the company planning to apply for a quota revision.

title: Indonesia orders world's biggest nickel mine to cut ore quota for 2026
summary: PT Weda Bay Nickel has been instructed to file a 2026 work plan for 12 million wet metric tonnes of production, down sharply from 42 million tonnes in 2025. The quota cut drove nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange up 2.2% to $17,880 per tonne, with the company planning to seek an upward revision.

title: Nickel price jumps as Indonesia's top mine cuts output
summary: Indonesia's quota cut at PT Weda Bay Nickel to 12 million tonnes drove LME nickel prices up 2% to $17,835 per tonne, extending a 20% rally since mid-December. The broader Indonesian quota reduction to 260-270 million tonnes for 2026 reflects the government's use of permits as a market lever to tighten global supply.

title: Indonesia Nickel Mining Quota Cut Impacts Market
summary: Following Indonesia's sharp cut to PT Weda Bay Nickel's mining quota, nickel prices climbed with the Shanghai Futures Exchange contract rising 2.49% to 140,570 yuan per metric ton and the London Metal Exchange benchmark rising 0.70% to $17,990 per ton. Analysts note that while prices are supported in the short term, Indonesia historically prevents prices from rising sustainably above $18,000 per tonne to protect domestic EV sector competitiveness.

title: Eramet: reaction to the initial production and sales volumes granted by the Indonesian authorities to its joint-venture PT Weda Bay Nickel
summary: Eramet announced that PT Weda Bay Nickel received an initial notification for a 2026 RKAB of 12 million wet metric tonnes, down from 42 million tonnes in 2025. The company acknowledged Indonesia's production quota policy and stated it will apply for a revision to support its installed smelter and HPAL facilities requiring above 100 million tonnes of supply.

title: ASX nickel stocks jump as Indonesia cuts production at giant Weda Bay mine
summary: Indonesia cut the 2026 production quota at PT Weda Bay Nickel by 71% to 12 million tonnes as part of a broader 30% reduction in national nickel mining quotas. The announcement boosted ASX-listed nickel stocks in response to the tightened supply outlook.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries Limited reported stable operations and a perfect safety record with zero lost-time injuries and 17.7 million safe man-hours in its Q4 2025 quarterly update. The company advanced sustainability through a strategic acquisition of a 10% stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received awards for ESG leadership. This highlights their commitment to workforce safety and integration into high-standard global supply chains.

title: New nickel-iron battery charges in seconds, survives 12,000 cycles
summary: UCLA researchers developed a nickel-iron battery prototype that recharges in seconds and endures over 12,000 cycles, equivalent to 30 years of daily use. The innovation uses 2D graphene and proteins to enhance conductivity, making it ideal for storing solar energy and grid backup in data centers. This builds on Thomas Edison's early concepts, promising sustainable solutions for renewable energy integration.

title: Prysmian, Versalis Launch Chemical Recycling Chain for Plastic Cable Waste in Italy
summary: Prysmian and Versalis have established a strategic partnership to create a closed-loop chemical recycling supply chain for plastic cable insulation, particularly cross-linked polyethylene (XLPE) used in energy cables. Versalis's Hoop® technology enables recovery of up to 60% of difficult-to-recycle materials, with pilot operations scheduled to begin in Italy in the second half of 2026.

title: Prysmian Closes the Acquisition of ACSM
summary: Prysmian has completed its acquisition of Spain-based ACSM, a submarine cable installation company, for €169 million ($198 million). The acquisition brings subsea surveying, seabed preparation, and installation capabilities in-house, strengthening Prysmian's position in the submarine cable sector.

title: Prysmian Signs Contract for the Delivery of Eastern Green Link 4
summary: Prysmian has signed a €2.3 billion contract with SP Energy Networks and National Grid to build the Eastern Green Link 4 power transmission link between Scotland and England. This represents a significant infrastructure project for the Italian cable maker specializing in energy and telecom cable systems.
